definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: It was headline news in Greece.
Avoid defacing headliner inside the vehicle .
sentences.chinese: 避免污損頭條新聞車內。

sentences.english: Nowadays the bird flu has been the frontpage news all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 現在全世界禽流感成了頭條新聞。

sentences.english: Nestling amongst the many headlines was one relating to our own Roman Abramovich!
sentences.chinese: 在很多頭條新聞中有一條是關於我們的老大阿布的。

sentences.english: When Roger was finally arrested, it was big news in Arkansas.
sentences.chinese: 羅傑最終還是被逮捕了，這在阿肯色州是頭條新聞。

sentences.english: The image created international headlines and sparked the legend of the Wem Ghost.
sentences.chinese: 圖像創建國際頭條新聞，並引發了威姆鬼的傳說。

sentences.english: Isn't it good to have Gusteau's name getting headlines?
sentences.chinese: 古斯特的大名上頭條新聞，不好嗎？

sentences.english: Every morning, I begin my day by reading newspaper headlines.
sentences.chinese: 每天，我都是以閱讀頭條新聞開始一天的工作的。

sentences.english: Headliners include Kenny Chesney, Miranda Lambert and Sugarland.
sentences.chinese: 頭條新聞包括肯尼切斯尼，米蘭達蘭伯特和糖城。

sentences.english: Wang's public apology is one of many campus incidents which have hit the headlines.
sentences.chinese: 王玉穆的公開道歉事件只是諸多校園頭條新聞之一。

sentences.english: You're in for 10 minutes of commercial-free headlines starting right this second.
sentences.chinese: 從現在開始，你將聽到10分鐘沒有廣告的頭條新聞。

definition: Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
